pr_title: KAFKA-9929: Support backward iterator on WindowStore

timeline.message: fix bytes range validator not needed

timeline.bodyText: I guess we should use the long signature here too, and do the conversion from Instant to long in a default implementation on the WindowStore interface?
timeline.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: Guessing this is not actually meant to be commented out 🙂
timeline.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText:
actually it could be removed: lastSegmentId should be stable going backwards based on timeFrom.
On the if branch, I assume that lastSegmentId could change in between iterations if maxObservedTimestamp is updated right?
replies.author: jeqo

replies.bodyText: Ah, good catch. That sounds right, the ending segment shouldn't change when you iterate backwards
replies.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: It feels kind of ridiculous to convert this from a list to a set to an array all in one line. Maybe we can use assertThat(result, equalTo(expectedResult)) here like we've started to do elsewhere in Streams?
timeline.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText: Wow this is embarrasing haha, looks like I was trying to get tests green without much thinking 😅
replies.author: jeqo

replies.bodyText: Haha actually I think I was the one who added the initial conversion from list to set to begin with, so I was clearly asking for trouble
replies.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText: Same here (and all the backwards ReadOnlyWindowStoreStub methods): I think we are kind of forced to invert the key ordering for the backwards fetch methods as well, even if we don't necessarily want to. Probably users shouldn't be relying on a strict ordering of the keys anyway but we do have to match the ordering of the cache
timeline.author: ableegoldman

timeline.message: adding long variant to backward methods.
fix: remove redundant array/set/list equals assertions
range and all already available on kvstore
